player

Class RandomPlayerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.RandomPlayerFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlayerFactory

    public class RandomPlayerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlayerFactory
    The RandomPlayerFactory is an example of a PlayerFactory that creates a series of random players. By default it assigns a random AI to each of the colours except Blue, which is controlled by the GUI.

      • player

        public Player player(Colour colour,
                     ScotlandYardView view,
                     java.lang.String mapFilename)
        Description copied from interface: PlayerFactory
        The player() method creates a new player that can play with the given colour, view and mapFilename.
        Specified by:
        player in interface PlayerFactory
        Parameters:
        colour - the colour of the player.
        view - the ScotlandYardView that provides game information.
        mapFilename - the name of the file that is being played.
        Returns:
        the Player that will play the given colour.

      • ready

        public void ready()
        Description copied from interface: PlayerFactory
        The ready() method will be called by the game when all of the players (both local and remote) have joined. If you need code to be executed after all players are joined, this is where it goes.
        Specified by:
        ready in interface PlayerFactory

      • getSpectators

        public java.util.List<Spectator> getSpectators(ScotlandYardView view)
        Description copied from interface: PlayerFactory
        A factory can also produce a number of Spectators for a game. These will normally be used for GUIs to spectate the game, or for AIs that want to be notified when moves have bee made.
        Specified by:
        getSpectators in interface PlayerFactory
        Parameters:
        view - the ScotlandYardView that provides game information.
        Returns:
        the list of all spectators that should be subscribed.

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Description copied from interface: PlayerFactory
        The finish() method will be called when the game is over. This is where you put code that does any clean-up you might require.
        Specified by:
        finish in interface PlayerFactory
